result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha E. Woods was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Conditions: Pay $200 fine plus costs ($715 total, to come out of bond; not to be collected by DOC); attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programming ordered by the agent; obey rules/regulations of probation. Credit in the event of revocation: parties stipulate to 0 days credit.

miscConds.notes: Collected by the Clerk of Court from posted bond. Nothing due to probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samantha E. Woods

defendant.name: Woods, Samantha E.
defendant.address: E4744 Riverside Dr, Spring Green, WI 53588

records.addlTxt: From DOC asking for amendment to JOC.

Defendant Samantha E. Woods in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA Harper notes that the Def did submit to booking today at the RCSD. DA informs the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution whereby def will plead to the single theft count in the complaint for probation and $200 plus costs. Def pleads guilty. Court's colloquy on plea. Finding of guilty. Sentence withheld for 2 years probation. Conditions: pay $200 fine plus costs ($715 total, to come out of bond); attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programming ordered by the agent; obey rules/regulations of probation. Credit in the event of revocation: Parties stipulate to 0 days credit.

records.addlTxt: 18R 001099 (Bond paid in Sauk County Sheriff's Dept. 02-14-18; Received check from Sauk County 02-28-18)
Adjourned initial appearance on March 2, 2018 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Samantha E. Woods in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Def states she had medical issues and couldn't attend hearings. Court directs def to call SPD and report to the court if she qualifies.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 2, 2018 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on February 23, 2018 at 01:15 pm.

RCSD DISPO OF WARRANT OR COMMITMENT
IN CUSTODY IOWA COUNTY JAIL, HOLD PLACED

Per RCSD Dispatch, on 2/13/18, Def was transported from Iowa County Jail to the Sauk County Jail. She also has a hold in Sauk Co. It is not known, at this time, what date she will be brought to Richland for this case.
Clerk's review of open cases without scheduling: request made to DA's office for DA review - warrant was authorized in 2016 but never put forth.

Adjourned initial appearance on June 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to submit to booking/printing at the Richland County Sheriff's Department by 4:30 p.m. on April 14, 2016.

Defendant Samantha E. Woods in court without counsel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Court states the charge and informs def of the possible max. penalties as well as her rights including right to counsel.  Def not likely to qualify for SPD or Dean counsel due to spouse's employment. DA states that she would discuss offer with def if def waives her right to counsel for the sole, limited purpose of said offer exchange. Def so waives for that purpose. DA asks def to make appointment at DA's office for that conference.  DA asks for $250 signature bond with booking requirement. So ordered.
Initial appearance on April 13, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
RCSD Dispo of Warrant or Commitment
to Those Posting Cash Bond
1:55 p.m.  No appearance by def who was served with the summons/complaint.  Warrant requested and ordered.
